text:
When editing in Bitflux with the newest versions of Mozilla (1.7), or Firefox 
(0.9), then choosing "Save & Exit", an OK message appears, but the editing 
actually was not saved.
Looking at the server log in WEB-INF/logs, there is an XML error:

ERROR   (2004-06-18) 12:24.23:346   [sitemap.handled-errors] 
(/lenya/default/authoring/Content1/testwolfgang-bxe.html) 
http8080-Processor24/PipelineNode: Failed to execute pipeline.
org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException: Failed to execute pipeline.: 
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Attribute "dummy" was already specified for 
element "html".

The first problem is that the user has no idea something went wrong, that is 
nothing is shown in the GUI.

The second problem is, of course, that the saving does not work.

I have no idea whether this is a Bitflux integration issue, or actually a 
Bitflux bug (though I looked at Bitflux bug reports I haven't seen anything 
about these browser versions)
creator: jwkaltz@apache.org

text:
News on the Bitflux site indicates that this is actually neither a Bitflux nor a 
Lenya bug, but a Mozilla issue:

the Mozilla bug entry:
http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=248172
a bug entry at Bitflux:
http://bugs.bitfluxeditor.org/show_bug.cgi?id=689
and a news item from Bitflux on this issue:
http://blog.bitflux.ch/p1729.html

This problem *should* disappear with the next release of Mozilla.
I will however leave the bug open, so all Lenya users can know what's
going on.

the new bxe release detects broken mozillas and shows a warning. also, new
mozilla versions have the fix.
creator: gregor@apache.org
